docTitle.titlePart:
Design, Synthesis and Antiproliferative Activity of Tripentones:
A New Series of Antitubulin Agents

byline.docAuthor:
Vincent Lisowski,
a Ceile Enguehard,
b Jean-Charles Lancelot,
a
Daniel-Henri Caignard,
c Stehanie Lambel,

c and Sylvain Rault
a, *

byline.affiliation: a Centre d'Etudes et de Recherche sur le Me´dicament de Normandie, UFR des Sciences Pharmaceutiques,

front.address: 1, rue Carle He´bert 92415 Courbevoie Cedex, France
front.note: Received 4 April 2001; revised 28 May 2001; accepted 7 June 2001
front.div:
Abstract—Structure–activity relationship studies of a new series of tripentones (thieno[2,3-b]pyrrolizin-8-ones), led us to prepare
several derivatives with antiproliferative activities. The most promising 3-(3-hydroxy-4-methoxyphenyl)thieno[2,3-b]pyrrolizin-8-
one 20 (leukemia L1210, IC 50 =15 nM) was shown to be a potent inhibitor of tubulin polymerization. #
